I took them for 6 months everyday and then stopped taking them because my hair was the length I wanted.<br />Today, I take them because due to stress, my hair is starting to thin and fall out much more than normal. I'm 30 years old and have been trying everything to get my hair to get thicker and longer, my hair stylist said that because of my age, how long my hair had been at that length for, and because of it not all that healthy it would not get any longer. So I was looking at my pictures of when I was pregnant with my son and shortly after then noticed that my hair was so beautiful, long thick, shinny and healthy. But what happened i wondered. I found out through word of mouth that it was the prenatal vitamins that had been doing that. So I bought high rated bottle of the vitamins for under $20 and it was 180 count one pill a day. Five months later, my hair has gotten 5 inches longer, so much healthier and thicker, not to mention my eyelashes look so awesome my skin, and nails too. Plus, I'm sure the health benefits are even better for you too. Even if this product dose work for you and you like or even love it, save you money and get prenatal.

Think about how hair growth works...this isn't topical.

  23. So I am a 24 y/o female who has had thinning hair since I was 16. I didn't really like the idea of taking vitamins so I didn't and little by little I noticed that my hair had gotten so thin that my hairline was receding and all throughout my I can see my scalp. I've lost over half of my hair. By the way, there's nothing like being told you're too young to lose your hair, because then you think you're being paranoid. I was losing hair by clump and shedding so much. KEEP READING.<br /><br />I've been on this for 3 days as of today(KEEP READING), you may be thinking that isn't enough time to review it but I need to tell you that I will keep buying this. You have to take it with other vitamins though and nothing is overnight amazing BUT I am taking vitamin d 5000 iu, Biotin 10,000 mcg's, and a daily multi vitamin. My hairline is filling back in, little baby hairs is better than tiny little invisible blond hairs where my dark hair was, my hair is really dark so I know if something is working. I'm taking pictures of my progress and so far I can tell you that if you can change your diet and take vitamins this will work for you. But you have to keep up with vitamins.<br /><br />I am extremely ecstatic that I'm getting my hair back, knowing that you are losing your hair a horrible feeling, but I've also stopped shedding. I can take my hair tie out of my hair and I don't have a huge clump of hair with it. This has changed my future. Please be safe when taking anything and following the directions but you will need to take this in conjunction with other things. Good luck!! :)

  26. I read all the great reviews even the reviews where ppl complained about it causing acne but I still wanted to give it a try in hopes that I was exempt. My cousin has been using it for months and her hair has gotten extremely thick. While she was using it I was on my 3rd bottle of hairfinity and I was not noticing any change. I was going to continue but my sister was already on her 6th bottle of hairfinity and said she experienced no hair growth, just nails and lashes. So with that in mind I switched on over to viviscal. Well I purchased a 1 month supply and within my 3rd week my bald spots on my edges were filled in it was unreal!!! When I was on my last two rows my skin began to break out heavily! I had cystic acne bumps popping up everywhere and my skin color became uneven. I had very bad acne years ago and havent had a break out in 3years because of my day and night acne regiment so having to deal with this kind of breakouts was a nightmare. I had to stop taking the pills and within a month my skin started to look clear and normal again... I was so bummed cause it does make your hair grow. I mentioned to my cousin how I had to stop and she said she did have breakouts but it went away as she kept taking it but she doesn't have acne prone skin, so I guess it all depends. I'm now taking Toji which has a few but perfect reviews and so far im impressed.

Rogaine, BCPs, every supplement imaginable, iron, diet changes, protein shakes, hanging upside down (don't judge, i'm desperate! lol) nothing has worked. My latest experiment was progesterone cream which i started 3 months ago. Initially my hair loss got worse and frizzy and wiry. I decided to try viviscal and hello! my hair loss has finally slowed down. (and my nails look amazing! I can hardly type cuz they're so long) I went from finding 40+ hairs in the drain to 4 or 5. I'm sweeping up less hair and there is hardly any when I run my fingers through my hair. My biggest issue is hair GROWTH though because my scalp is highly visible. The only warning I have is that for me (I have very fine hair) if I take the supplement twice a day my roots tend to get greasy-but I figure that means the product is working and it's nothing that dry shampoo can't fix. I highly recommend Viviscal to anyone struggling to grow their hair!!

  141. I had two small stress-related bald spots I wanted to regrow as quickly as possible. I started taking the Viviscal tablets as directed religiously, and in conjunction with some other vitamins, worked like a charm. It does not work overnight -- it took time, but now, about eight months after first discovering the two bald spots, they're both completely grown over with hair, and my biggest problem is how to make my new growth blend in with the rest of my hair instead of sticking straight out the side of my head. :) A few tips: one, I started taking a stand-alone iron supplement and generally felt better. I believe it also contributed to my relatively quick regrowth. Two, be aware if you take Viviscal in conjunction with a biotin supplement, it may cause cystic acne. Too much biotin may cause cystic acne, and once I flushed some excess biotin from my vitamin regimen, the cystic acne cleared up. Three, you can buy generic Viviscal from CVS, usually at a substantial discount from the retail price of Viviscal. Four, I believe religious use is key -- I never missed one pill. That said, I'm a total believer, and now that my bald spots have cleared up, I continue to take the Viviscal because my hair and hairline have never looked better.

  214. I am giving this product an honest review because my experience with it was not good but the product itself is not at fault. I admit I was not careful enough before I used it and I have learned, the hard way from my mistake. One the first things I noticed is that my skin and scalp became very oily when I started using this product. My hair did grew a bit faster, so it does work. Unfortunately, that means ALL hair, including underarms, legs, etc. with means more waxing and shaving, ugh! I used to have acne, but when I became a vegetarian my complexion became very clear and smooth. But when I started using this product I noticed that my skin became oily, coarse and pimples came back with a vengeance. Also these pills have a nasty fishy aftertaste! that made me super-nauseous. Eventually I just gave up the plan of growing my hair because losing my skin and my sanity over it was just not worth it and I gave them away. I still think they are good pills though, for a non-vegetarian who doesn't have an issue downing fishy tasting pills. But they do work.

I will say there is SOMETIMES a slightly fishy aftertaste from the fish oil, but nothing too bad and I personally have small surface acne outbreaks on my chest from time to time which may be attributed to the fish oils but that is a personal reaction I always have to fish oil and it is MINOR, short-lived and definitely worth the pay off. I guess I will be continuing for the initial 6 months afterall, and once I reach my desired length I will probably still take it once a day for maintenance!

  292. IMPORTANT UPDATE! My original review shows below. I have an update<br /><br />I went for my anual physical, albeit a couple of months more than I should have gone.<br /><br />On my last physical, my liver ensymes were 24 and 26 or something like that. Normal is anywhere from 0 to 40.<br /><br />On this physical exam, my liver ensymes were 86 and 89. My doctor was worried and talked of possible liver damage.<br /><br />He suspected one of the suplements that I am taking saying that suplements are not regulated by the FDA and that many are made outside of the U.S., mostly in China, where other ingredients are added for one reason or the other.<br /><br />To shorten the story a bit, upon a retest my liver ensymes returned to 25 / 27. I had removed the suplements that I was taking. My doctor was right.<br /><br />If you are still reading, guess which won.<br /><br />I still have to physically prove these, as I took three of them. I was taking the Great Earth NSP program, GNC Women's Hair Skin and Nails formula, and now for this past year Viviscal. I have been taking like clockwork the GNC stuff since 2006 every day. I have been taking the not pleasant tasting huge tablets of Great Earth for two decades or so, maybe even longer. The only new thing added was shortly after my last physical was the Viviscal. Everything else remained the same.<br /><br />This product is unsafe. Anyone taking this product should get tested regularly. Not everyone is equal. I have always been sensitive, so your liver may not act up.<br /><br />I will say that until proven by successive retests, there is still the possibility that either Great Earth or GNC were the culprit by suddenly outsourcing their product. I looked at the GNC box and they say that GNC is the distributor, not the manufacturer. They neglect to say who the manufacturer is or where it was made. Great Earth vitamins if I remember correctly are made here, but still not submitted for FDA approval. Still, everything points to the new kid on the block, Viviscal.<br /><br />Oh yes, my doctor said to rather spend the money on clothing, shoes, or my family.<br /><br />Laser comb, Rogaine, Latisse (when it comes out), and a hair transplant are much safer ways of dealing with hair loss.<br /><br />------<br /><br />In one phrase, no positive results.<br /><br />I should give a zero or negative number, but I will be nice.<br /><br />I started May 2011 with the tablets, head lotion, and the HairMax LaserComb Professional 12. I stayed with it and tried the best.<br /><br />Note:<br />* I will say what others told me. It is hard to comment, because I do not know how my hair would look like 10 months later if I did nothing or just the Viviscal or just the LaserComb. I started losing more hair early last year, still am. Maybe my hair now might be worse.<br /><br />What I can say is that there was an increase in hair loss followed by stagnation.<br /><br />I went to a hair doctor the other week, who looked at my hair folicles through a microscope. I saw thick hairs and thin hairs and hair in between, so I am actively still losing hair. The best that I can say is that nothing happened.<br /><br />I will also say that another problem with Viviscal and other DIY type of things that there is nobody to talk to or ask help.<br /><br />I asked the doctor about Viviscal and his comment was that Viviscal never went through formal testing, has never been shown to be of use, and has ingredients that do nothing, in other words a plocebo. If it helps, it is because people think that it can and therefore does. Viviscal has the power of suggestion.<br /><br />Some people comment on fuller hair. I saw no thickening or anything else different. I also use GNC's Hair, Skin, and Nails. That seems to do more, at least for my nails.<br /><br />The 2 rating is because maybe in the long run it helped or at least I felt that I was doing something, but my vote is with the doctor. Sadly, the pills do not do anything. Also, the DIY approach is a turn off.<br /><br />Anyone wanting to work on regrowing hair should better spend the money seeing a professional, possibly getting FUE (Folicle Unit Extraction) or a version of Minoxidil or other treatments available.ot do anything. Also, the DIY approach is a turn off.<br /><br />Anyone wanting to work on regrowing hair should better spend the money seeing a professional, possibly getting FUE (Folicle Unit Extraction) or a version of Minoxidil or other treatments available.

  296. I have been taking Viviscal since December 2011.My hairdresser and I were both alarmed at my thinning hair and felt I needed to start taking Viviscal ASAP. My hair loss was attributed to stress due to my husband's unexpected illness. Well, initially--I noticed my hair stopped shedding when I combed and washed it. Ah--a sigh of relief heard around the world! That was basically it through the winter months....limited shedding and no breakage. Now that it is spring--I am noticing an increase in new growth around my hairline. I have upped my dosage to 3x's a day based upon my hairdresser's recommendation. The winter months were very challenging for me and my family and I attribute this factor to my not seeing anything major happen in the thickness department. I remain confident Viviscal will make a difference for me in the long run. My skin and nails are also benefiting from Viviscal. Since I am no longer a sweet young thing - I cannot attest to my hair growing super fast as some have reported. On the other hand--I am not yet positioned with one foot on a banana peel and the other in the grave yet either. If you are middle-aged+ -- be patient. I did find my hair does gets quite \\"oily\\" as others have mentioned. This is always more noticeable on those of us with silky fine hair. I would like to add that the shipment I ordered through Viviscal was past it's expiration date. I ordered it in April and the expiration date was March 2012. Duh! I just noticed this the other morning. One should never assume. If you order this product--check the expiration date. I do not fault Amazon. It was the purveyor who shipped the item through the Amazon site. I have had better luck with \\"other\\" online sources.
  297. I'm glad they've lowered the price a little on this. Viviscal works. All my life I have wanted thicker, longer hair! When I went in for color, she looked at me strangely and asked if I got hair extensions!! It was triple the amount while I was taking Viviscal. I guess it helped me hold onto hair that was in the telogen phase.<br /><br />My hair did grow at a slightly faster rate than before as well. Overall though, I think I could've gotten the same results taking some generic biotin and other vitamins myself. Not worth the $50-60 price tag (for 60 tablets). If it's $25-30, maybe.

I started using a magnesium drink every night which helped with that and is super good for you anyway. I use the product &#34;Calm&#34; which can be purchased on Amazon as well. Other than that I did not gain weight or have sleep issues. That maybe placebo. Also, if you're not eating fiber or taking magnesium I could see mistaking the bloat for gaining weight. Overall, it's a good product to use if you have fine hair, but it's not going to totally change from super fine to mega thick.

  535. I have enjoyed the results of using this product. My goal was thicker and longer hair - for years, I hadn't been able to get it to grow longer than a certain point. I combined this product with vitamin B/folic acid and biotin supplements, tried to start treating my hair better (deep conditioner treatments, better hair products, less washing and use of styling tools), and cut back (pun) on highlighting and trimming it to just once every 4-6 months. I think after about 6 months I started to notice the length improving, and after 1 year there was definitely a significant difference - my hair was the longest it had been in 7 years. It has been 2 years now. In the second year, my hair hasn't grown much longer than the length I achieved after 1 year, but I think it is significantly thicker and still improving.<br /><br />One note: I noticed that whenever I took the product consistently/multiple days in a row, I would start to break out on my chin - and I don't even have oily skin to begin with. To fix this, I would make sure to avoid putting cream on the problem area and only take the product every other day or so, instead of every single day.<br /><br />The only complaint I would have is that it takes a long time to see the effects of product use, but I think that when it comes to hair growth, that's just how things are.

  572. I heard about this product on the Today Show so I thought I would try it. I was the biggest skeptic in the world. After having used the product faithfully for 3 months I can say, \\"It works!\\" I have low-thyroid and this product has helped my hair grow back.
  573. After your body goes through significant weight loss, it is normal to experience hair loss as your body is in a state of malnutrition. No matter what you diet consists of, weight loss will temporarily cause the body to behave as its malnourished. Also, androgenic hormones and other 'toxins' are trapped in fatty tissue and release into the blood stream after they break down. This leads to hair loss and is an undesirable effect.<br /><br />Viviscal has been great in combating these problems for me. Although I eat a diet rich in nutrients, fruits, vegetables, and fatty acids the simple act of losing weight was causing distressing hair loss. After taking this product for about 3 months now, I've definitely noticed less hair coming out in the shower and thicker hair. It is growing faster as well, but for me, I think the thickening factor is more noticeable than growth. Hey, that's totally alright with me! Both are a good deal. I've gotten many comments on how thick my hair is becoming, and I'm even noticing new growth around my temples where I normally have wispy baby hair. I never had bald patches or thinning isolated areas, but now I can see that the wispy hair is thickening and thats good. I'm definitely going to continue purchasing and using this product.
  574. I have been using Viviscal Extra Strength Hair Nutrient tablets, 60-tablets/package for the last three months and my hair is actually getting thicker and you can't see the bald spots any more. Thank you so much for making this wonderful product and I have told all of my friends about it too. I am getting ready to order some more this month. I found about this product through my hair dresser.
  575. I've been using it for over 6 months now and I can say with certainty that it definitely accelerates hair growth!!! My first instinct was to suspect the Viviscal but I stuck it out thinking that my suspicions may have been a bit caustic and unwarranted. I didn't want to discontinue using it because I was seeing such a noticeable difference in my hair growth. Yet, over 6 months later despite persistent dieting as well as upping the ante on my exercise routine I still could not point to anything else that would have caused the weight gain that I can not seem to take off! I am naturally thin and have NEVER had an issue with staying at my ideal weight or taking off a couple of pounds when needed. I was so frustrated that I just went to the Viviscal website to see if weight gain was a potential side effect and to my chagrin found it listed with the disclaimer (of course) that it is but very rare.<br /><br />I searched the postings of the more critical reviewers to see if this downside is more common but didn't find anything. Perhaps I am in that very small minority or just one among an unnumbered silent few who has gained weight but wasn't sure if they could attribute it to their Viviscal usage. There is no way of course for me to verify my accusation but I just wanted to put it out there just in case anyone is dealing with the same problem and thinks they're crazy. With the exception of this unfortunate side effect I would give it 5 stars. Best of luck!

  587. I'm a 27 year old female who has been experiencing extreme hair loss since I quit the pill two years ago (ladies, think twice before you commit to those crazy hormones!). Before then, I had gorgeous, thick hair. It was so thick I used to complain I had too much (yeah, I'd like to go back in time and kick myself for that comment). There's no history of hair loss in my family. My dad is nearly sixty and he's just now beginning to have a thin spot on top. I've tried everything to get my lush hair back-- getting my levels tested, going gluten-free, taking every vitamin that has any mention of hair-growing properties, etc. All my tests have returned normal. Hell, if you said that dousing my hair in Turkish imported donkey piss would grow my hair back, I'd do it. The depression and lack of confidence I've experienced from hair loss is terrible. I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy. I originally tried Viviscal months ago and it broke me out, so I stopped using it. I also was taking only one pill. I've been using Viviscal for about ten days now (2 pills per day) after I looked in the cupboard and realized I didn't want to waste such an expensive product. No breakouts yet! I also take this in conjunction with biotin (10,000 mcg) and Vitamin D. I will say my hair is softer and feels like it has a little more body. My boyfriend asked if I had dyed my hair because it looked darker to him. I'm not sure if that's the Viviscal or the Mane & Tail I use. I do find it makes my hair greasy quickly, which I dislike. It does seem like I'm noticing less hair on my clothes, when I style, etc. I plan on using the full six month run to see if there are any further results and plan to update at three and six months. Good luck to everyone on their hair growing journey! EDIT 2/18 My hair loss has decreased dramatically. I don't find myself picking hairs off all my clothes throughout the day as much. Just knowing that there isn't crazy amounts of hair bailing from my head every day has done a lot to help me feel better about my hair. It feels thicker when I gather it in my hands, which seems impossible given that I haven't been using it for a full hair cycle, but there it is. It definitely has more softness and body now though is still very fly away from all the breakage. I do see little hair poking up but I can't decide yet whether they are new growth or just the sad remnants of broken off strands. I'm hoping for the former. The really troubled spots (sides & crown) aren't filling in yet, but hey, there's a lot of damage to fix, and while its no where near my gorgeous hair of yesteryear, I can live with it now. I'm not experiencing the crippling anxiety I felt going out in public with my hair of 4-5 weeks ago. I'm hopeful that Viviscal will give me even better hair. More updates to come. Edit 4/1/15 So I recently received a compliment on my hair from a stranger recently. THAT is big news for me, because it hasn't happened in a loooong time. It's been about 2.5 months since I started (I estimate I began the last week of January), and my hair is soft, full, and the male pattern baldness around my temples has begun to fill in. Shedding has become so minimal that I'm not loathe to see a strand of hair come out. I'm really hoping to have a completely different head of hair in the full six month period. I no longer feel worried that people are noticing my hair. I also take naturethroid to help my thyroid, along with other vitamins, and try to add oil to my hair and scalp at night before I shower the next day. While it's not Victoria Secret model hair, it's just really great to be free of the worry and anxiety.

  611. I have been doing hair for 7 years now, and I always gave Biotin such high praise for actually thickening the hair after continued usage...along with slightly faster hair growth. Biotin is no wonder pill, but it works pretty well when you're good about taking it everyday. Unfortunately, the hard truth is that with most supplements (even viviscal)...it's going to take extended usage to see results. For women who are past menopause...much longer as your hormones (which control hair growth) are depleted greatly. ONTO the the GOOD stuff. Viviscal works a good bit better than Biotin with regular usage. I have been using it for a mere 5 weeks and the growth is...kind of shocking to be honest. I didn't expect it to work so fast. Let me also tell you all that I am 29 yrs old, and do not have thinning hair problems. I started taking it because I cut 5 inches off of my hair that I want back more than anticipated. I can NOT begin to tell you all how much hair is growing. I had a small hole of missing hair in my brow that I over tweezed that is finally growing back after almost a year (gasp!) of not growing. Its kind of weird to be honest. Also- my leg hairs are growing twice as fast...which is not fun. This is just 5 weeks. Like I said, for older women who are pre or post menopausal, I doubt it will pack as much of a punch. Unfortunately, getting older means less hair growth, and there is no miracle pill to naturally fix that...yet. My hair DEFINITELY feels thicker at the base after just 5 weeks, and it's not placebo effect. Trust me..it is so much thicker. Just be vigilant about using the stuff...like any supplement. Also keep in mind that if you are a thin haired individual naturally, that it might take longer to notice. I have told about a dozen clients about it...that is how much I love the stuff. I say try it for 3 months before you knock it. 3 months equals about 3/4 inches of hair growth for slow growers and 1 1/2 inches for fast growers. if your hair is growingslightly faster than what your average is, then its working. 3 months is a good base to see a difference and measure it. IT totally works!

  642. THIRD UPDATE: 5 months and about a week since I started. No new hair. Thinning has very slightly become worse. Hairs that were not thinning are still growing faster than normal. I will say on this for another month. My right kidney area seems to hurt often, but I have no way of knowing that this is causing that.<br /><br />UPDATE: 3 Months. Still no noticeable change in my hair.<br /><br />Been using it for 2.5 months. Haven't seen any results. Hair loss that has not changed at all since I started. It's kinda expensive. I've read you should only take horsetail for short periods of time. Once you are done with the six months you need to keep taking this to keep the effects. So this isn't a permanent solution to anything. My hair has grown faster since using this but I have seen zero new hairs on my head. Hair isn't thicker or anything. Just grows faster. I may very well end up doing the full six months but I'm not getting my hopes up.<br /><br />One of the primary constituents of horsetail extract is thiaminase. Thiaminase is an enzyme that breaks down thiamine, a nutrient also known as vitamin B-1. Treatment with horsetail extract may significantly increase the amount of thiaminase in your body, which may cause a vitamin B-1 deficiency. Low vitamin B-1 levels, a condition called beriberi, may cause serious symptoms.<br /><br />Google the side effects of horsetail...<br /><br />Horsetail also contains silica apparently... and too much can cause kidney problems. I have noticed some minor pain in my left kidney area. But that could be nothing.<br /><br />I will update at 6 months. I'm 19 years old. Male. Have a receded hairline. In good shape and eat as well as I can. I figure if it doesn't help a 19 year old with with hair loss it sure wont help anyone 30+<br /><br />Saw a dateline special where a man used it for a year and had no new hairs, but the existing hair was growing faster. Look it up.

  742. Excellent hair product, it really works to thicken hair
  743. I believe this product is counterfeit. My review has nothing to do with Vivescal itself, which I still use and buy directly off their website. The pills I purchased through Amazon were cheaper, yes, but I started to suspect something was wrong when the packaging was so cheap that taking out one pill usually led to the backing coming off several pills. So I decided to purchased my next batch through the manufacturer itself. First and foremost, while I likely couldn't tell unless I was doing a side-by-side comparison (which I did), the pills are different sizes. Second, the material used for the backing of the pills is a bit thicker and thus doesn't run when you try to take one pill out. I can't say for sue, but I doubt these pills are real, and rather than take the chance of buying and consuming fake pills, I will be buying directly from the manufacturer.

  875. I had typed a longer review but my browser crashed so here is my second and shorter attempt to submit one:<br /><br />June 2011: diagnosed with alopecia due to stress and vitamin deficiency. Small area of hair had fallen out beneath the top layers near the crown. Had to style my hair so the bare area wouldn't show. Began taking Resveratrol on dermatologist's advice.<br />November 2011: an incompetent new colourist I was trying out re-highlighted all of my fine straight/slightly wavy hair instead of doing just the roots, which caused severe damage and my hair started breaking off. Agadir Argan Oil Moisture Masque made it even worse, causing my hair to rip like wet spaghetti, so I chucked it. There were damaged layers in my hair that was previously all one length. Catastrophe.<br />December 2012: Dejected, I began applying jojoba oil and wearing it in a chignon. I returned to my original salon with reliable hair professionals.<br />March 2012: The area of missing hair grew back in after alopecia subsided.<br />April 2012: I started taking Megafood multivitamins. I began washing and conditioning my hair with organic products. No more sulfate products.<br />May 2012: I discovered Viviscal in British Elle, ordered it, and began taking it mid-month. After two weeks of using Viviscal twice daily, I noticed my nails were growing much faster.<br /><br />At this point my hair was about five to six inches below my shoulders.<br /><br />July 2012: I noticed 3/4 inch of hair growth with a tape measure. My hair became oilier more often, but I didn't mind.<br />August 2012: I missed five days of Viviscal before resuming again, and got a healthy hair cut so the damage didn't get worse and slow progress. I started using Philip Kingsley Elasticizer Extreme on recommendation from a salon in London.<br />September 2012: Consistently taking Viviscal. Ran out of Megafood vitamins. I tried not to think about the length so I didn't measure my growth. Near the end of the month, I had a 1/4 inch trim at a long hair salon.<br />October 2012: I missed another 4-5 days of Viviscal when I ran out during a trip and the local shops didn't carry it. Nonetheless, within a month from my last highlighting touch up, most of my hair had grown a full 1 inch, with some areas at 3/4 and baby hair areas a bit less (different areas of hair naturally grow at different rates). Throughout the month I took a 3000mg Biotin supplement with and without Viviscal. No trimming.<br />November 2012: Ran out of Biotin, but taking Viviscal consistently. Actually, it's the only thing I'm taking now. I trimmed 1/4 inch off myself. My hair is healthier, stronger, shinier, and definitely longer.<br /><br />By this time I have been air-drying my hair on large rollers, using jojoba oil, sleeping on a satin pillowcase, and detangling with a high quality comb instead of brushing. I rarely use a hairbrush now. No pill can keep up with the damage a person does on the hair itself, so I believe the gentler treatment has helped the results. Now when I get my hair highlighted, I turn down the free blow dry, and I warm/cool blow dry it myself at the salon using my fingers or comb with the dryer at a distance, without subjecting my hair to the extremely damaging brushes used on wet hair aside from the infernal heat that salons normally set dryers to. I don't remember exactly when I stopped taking Resveratrol, but it was sometime in early 2012.<br /><br />The length of my hair is now at my lower mid-back with full, even ends, about 5 inches from my waist. I will see how much more growth will kick in after the six month period. It has been 6 months since I started taking Viviscal. I highly recommend it to those who are patient and can safely take it.inch trim at a long hair salon.<br />October 2012: I missed another 4-5 days of Viviscal when I ran out during a trip and the local shops didn't carry it. Nonetheless, within a month from my last highlighting touch up, most of my hair had grown a full 1 inch, with some areas at 3/4 and baby hair areas a bit less (different areas of hair naturally grow at different rates). Throughout the month I took a 3000mg Biotin supplement with and without Viviscal. No trimming.<br />November 2012: Ran out of Biotin, but taking Viviscal consistently. Actually, it's the only thing I'm taking now. I trimmed 1/4 inch off myself. My hair is healthier, stronger, shinier, and definitely longer.<br /><br />By this time I have been air-drying my hair on large rollers, using jojoba oil, sleeping on a satin pillowcase, and detangling with a high quality comb instead of brushing. I rarely use a hairbrush now. No pill can keep up with the damage a person does on the hair itself, so I believe the gentler treatment has helped the results. Now when I get my hair highlighted, I turn down the free blow dry, and I warm/cool blow dry it myself at the salon using my fingers or comb with the dryer at a distance, without subjecting my hair to the extremely damaging brushes used on wet hair aside from the infernal heat that salons normally set dryers to. I don't remember exactly when I stopped taking Resveratrol, but it was sometime in early 2012.<br /><br />The length of my hair is now at my lower mid-back with full, even ends, about 5 inches from my waist. I will see how much more growth will kick in after the six month period. It has been 6 months since I started taking Viviscal. I highly recommend it to those who are patient and can safely take it.

  913. I have almost hip length hair. I want my hair to grow longer, say down to my butt. My sister thinks I'm crazy but I guess I have a bad case of hair greed. Now it does no good to have long, dry, brittle hair--and my hair is horribly prone to split ends and frizzies (poofs like crazy during a humid southern summer)--so I decided to try out hair vitamins/supplements. I had been taking a hair vitamin by Country Life and it was working well for me but I wasn't achieving the growth I wanted after months of use. I stumbled upon Viviscal while browsing on Amazon and decided to try it out. I have been taking this supplement for about 2-3 weeks. It has made my nails super strong (almost afraid I'll grow crazy nail claws like Lady Deathstrike!), and while I haven't noticed any significant growth, I feel that my hair is a bit stronger. The reason why I won't give this product 5 stars is for two reasons: 1) time -- need to see if in the recommended 3-6 months, this product delivers, 2) the principal ingredient of shark powder in the AminoMar Marine Complex. Although shark powder (aka cartilage as labelled by previous Viviscal packaging) seems pretty innocuous, recent studies has found that shark cartilage contains a neurotoxin called BMAA which leads to neurodegenerative disease. I was completely unaware of this bit of science until recently after watching a documentary on the shark trade. I have not found any information clearing this product, which reiterating has shark CARTILAGE (powder is a rosy-tinted word for cartilage... I should know being a biomedical science graduate student), as BMAA-free. Until I obtain evidence certifying without a doubt that the shark powder/cartilage in the AminoMar Complex is BMAA-free, I am staying the hell away from this product. Strong hair or neurodegenerative disease? You decide.<br /><br />TL;DR - wanted to grow hair longer, discovered Viviscal, but found, to my chagrin, that it contained shark powder/cartilage which recent research has linked to neurodegenerative disease. For anyone wanting to read more about this: Environmental neurotoxins β-N-methylamino-l-alanine (BMAA) and mercury in shark cartilage dietary supplements by Mash et al.

I immediately stopped taking it. I noticed a huge difference the very next day. the foggyness had lifted, and the headache was not as achy. It did take a full 3 days after stopping this supplement for the headache to completely subside.... conclusion... never again!<br /><br />If this has happened to u, then you should discontinue it immediately.

  986. I have been taking them for a year because my hair started to fall. I have seen improvement, so I continue to take Viviscal since it is the only one who helped to stop me from going bald.
  987. I have been taking these as part of my &#34;hair growth&#34; regimen for a couple of years now. I have always had very fine hair, but in quantity. This quantity has diminished significantly over the past 5 years...I noticed a little bare spot (about 1/4 cm) on my part about 3 years ago, and my hairline has definitely been much sparser in the widows peaks, and my scalp was visible thoughout if I didn't brush my hair flat against my head. I felt VERY self concious and decided to do something about it. I have always taken &#34;hair skin & nails&#34; supplements, but they just didn't seem to make that big of a difference. After taking these for about 6 months, the little bald spot had filled in. I added a &#34;hair essentials&#34; from a different website, and an additional 10,000 mcg of Biotin (natrol brand) from Amazon and my hair has never been as thick as it is now. My hairline is all filled in--my widows peaks which looked as bad as the Evil Queens from Disney are completely filled in. My hair is growing very fast--1.5 inches per month. I did take a 6 month break from the viviscal to see if it would make a difference, and my growth and hair health definitely was negatively impacted. The only negative thing in the regimen is the massive dose of biotin makes me break out, but if I take Zinc on a daily basis it seems to counteract that. I do color treat and flat iron my hair, so it suffers a lot on a daily basis. I have tried all sorts of expensive shampoos and conditioners and found them to be a waste...beauty truly comes from within!

  990. 60 million Americans experience some form of hair loss or thinning hair. I didn't know that there were this many Americans suffering from thinning hair or it falling out. When people think of thinning or balding hairlines they think of men, yet it's just as true for women.<br /><br />When a woman starts experiencing hair loss, she thinks of herself less. Her self esteem hits rock bottom and she can't stop thinking about how much hair she has lost, or will continue to lose.<br /><br />They let their hair loss run their lives. They stop doing certain activities that they may enjoy because it can add to their hair loss or thinning hair. They feel ashamed about it, and therefore keep it to themselves- feeling reluctant to tell other people about it.<br /><br />My hair before I became pregnant was a little on the thicker side. Not too thick- but just the way I like it to be. It wasn't thinning, it wasn't falling out in large amounts every time I'd take a shower or wash my hair.<br /><br />After getting pregnant with my son and him being born 16 weeks premature is when I first noticed that my hair was beginning to thin out. Every time I'd wash it there would be hundreds of hairs on the bottom of the shower when I was through.<br /><br />I seriously thought there was something wrong with me. I didn't know what to do. I actually went to the doctor about it and they told me it was pregnancy hormones making my hair thin out.<br /><br />Not until later did I find out that this might be true, but the stress was also a trigger into hair thinning. I've been very thankful that it wasn't the \\"patchy\\" hair loss. Nobody seemed to notice a difference except me. There wasn't any bald spots, so I just kept on with my life.<br /><br />My hair always and still does grow quickly, but has been thinning since my first pregnancy. Even going to the doctor welded no results to helping me. I've longed for a thick head of hair since post-pregnancy seven years ago.<br /><br />It didn't help that I would dye it, blow-dry it, and straighten it- adding to the damage. I hated the washed out look my hair would get WHEN I didn't dye it though.<br /><br />Now that I have found VIviscal Extra Strength, I can already see a slight difference even though I haven't been using it for the entire month. Every time I take a shower, I've noticed less and less hair falling out. It's gotten thicker with more body!<br /><br />You take 2 extra strength pills on a daily basis for a minimum of 3-6 months depending on how bad your hair is thinning/balding and you'll see a big difference.<br /><br />It helps that the pills are easy to swallow and don't smell or taste funny. Although I've never had an issue taking medicines, I know people who can't swallow some larger pills or if they have a weird smell or taste.<br /><br />I can't wait to see what the results bring after I'm done with the entire box. I was on French hair vitamins for a year, which benefitted my nails but didn't stop the hair loss. This product looks promising. I'm combining it with 5000mg of biotin a day, as advised by my MD. The hair fall has improved significantly. I don't get what I call kamikaze hair anymore, hair which just falls off randomly during the day and tickles your arms and get stuck on your clothes. I also don't see any more hair fall with the bulbs attached. I do get a few strands coming out when I shampoo and a few more when I comb the hair wet. My hairdresser was sick the other day and her colleague took over. He made a comment about my hair being stronger and asked me what I'm doing different. I just glossed over it because I didn't want to jinks my progress, but the comments have really backed up my opinion that this product works. I will continue using it, probably forever! I know it will take time to replace what took years to lose. I'm just glad there's something on the market that will help me do that. I'm leaving my rating as 4 stars because I'm waiting to see if at the 6 month mark the hair fall truly stops. But I'm backing this product 100%! 8 August 2015. It's back to almost as bad as the beginning, and frankly I'm surprised because my hair was really thicken up with the new growth. I'm praying that the viviscal hasn't suddenly lost potency and also worried that simple illnesses can reverse the gain that I've had with the pills so far. My hair is looking ragged and thin again after the last few weeks of serious hair fall.   1086. Now first keep in mind everyone is different and what works for some may not work for others.<br /><br />Over the past two years, I have had an unfortunate encounter with female pattern baldness. My hair started unexplainingly falling out like crazy in the shower. People were constantly commenting on my hair being all over the place everywhere I went. I went to three doctors to find the cause as hair loss does not run in my family at all. I had the same answer from all of them.....stress. Do I believe it was caused from stress? No. One doctor suggested if maybe I am not in fact under stress it could possibly just be that when you get older naturally you lose more hair. I am only 30 and he told me this when I was 29.<br /><br />So I decided to tackle this on my own. I tried a gluten free diet as I have heard from others it helps. It didn't help me. I tried rogaine as my scalp was starting to show. However, rogaine was causing me to have heart palpitations and the pounding heart stopped the night I stopped rogaine. So I went on Amazon to check reviews of things that may have worked for others in my situation. I found Viviscal and bought it. I am not even kidding you when I honestly tell you this THE NIGHT I started taking Viviscal my hair loss in the shower was the lowest I have had in the past 2 years. Ever since the shedding has stopped.<br /><br />I have been taking this supplement for the past 30 days and just purchased more for the next cycle. And in the past 30 days my hair shedding has decreased by 90%, easily. I don't have any new growth yet and I really don't know if my hair is growing faster but I do know that my eyelashes have grown a lot, my lip now needs waxing when I get my eyebrows waxed, and my nails are growing like they never have. I fell so relieved and I could kiss the creators of Viviscal! I am so THANKFUL.<br /><br />SIde effects:<br />I did break out with one or two pimples the first week but it hasn't happened again<br />EAT when you take this,or you will get an upset stomach with cramping as well<br />I feel energized more than usual as well<br />Eyelash growth<br />fine hair on upper lip has grown (waxing takes it right off with no problem)<br />nail growth<br /><br />This may not work for you, however, it just might give you your hair back as it has improved mine. I think it is worth the $40 risk. Good luck!
